website_summaries.verdict: The price is a bit high for what you get, but the extras almost make it worth it.
pros: 4-position independent reclining seats which can be adjusted with one hand
Front wheels' locking swivels give it a good turn radius
cons: It's heavy and difficult to unfold

customer_reviews.title: Tall parents dream come true!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is perfect for tall parents! It is so light weight when strolling it's like a Zero turn lawn mower.lol and plenty of room below the seats to put diapers & a few shopping bags. With a little maneuvering with the wheels & I usually get it through every door. Definitely selling my sit&stand graco bc of the bulkiness. My kids are age 2 & 9 months and they fit great, My 6 year old nephew sat in it with my 9 month old, a little heavy, but was able to still push it through Disney. The only thing I would change is that I wish the head cover covered more.
customer_reviews.author: D.D. Cash

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't waste a penny on this
customer_reviews.text: We took this stroller to Disney World and used it 1 week, yes just 1 week. By the end of the week you would have thought I used it for years and through many kids. The wheels are wobbly now and when you push it the whole thing gets stuck. I wouldn't waste a penny on this.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Foster

customer_reviews.title: Worse experience ever
customer_reviews.text: Worse stroller ever. Going over cracks in sidewalk or uneven pavement was impossible. Never had a stroller not roll over bumps and uneven pavement before.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose and I like the ease of folding it and stowing it away ...
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this stroller to go to Disney, since the one we had is not only huge/bulky, but my twins sit one behind the other. This stroller seemed to be more practical and we now use it more than the other. It serves its purpose and I like the ease of folding it and stowing it away in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri0605

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this stroller. We had it for a few years and finally sold it to get an in-line one for Disney. It’s really quite comparable to Maclaren. We noticed we liked several things about it more than the maclarens we have had.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a single chicco lite way that I like a lot. I have a baby jogger city select double. Pros: easy to open, lighter weight, small storage in car, easy to recline, nice seatbelts Cons: sun shades are too short, basically useless and they come unattached whenever I fold to put in car. Cup holder also comes off way too easily. It occurred to me that this was to make the stroller fit through tighter spaces if need be, but I just lose the cup holder all the time. Seats are a little shallow.
customer_reviews.author: Iheartamazon

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrible stroller. I wish I had a way to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible stroller. I wish I had a way to test it out before I purchased it online. It's VERY heavy for an umbrella double stroller. It doesn't collapse and open easily. It's stiff and has a lot of resistance with opening and closing. It BARELY fits through a doorway. The wheels have about 1/2" clearance on each side to fit through a standard commercial door. Chicco customer service is full of snarky, unhelpful jerks. The stroller shipped to us and it was broken. Chico acted like they were doing us a favor by sending us a replacement stroller that fell with in the product warranty guidelines. I should have spent the extra money and purchased the Maclaren
customer_reviews.author: MrsMidwest98

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, wish I'd gotten it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Love it! Reclines, lots of options. Easy to push. My twins don't mind being in it. Can actually put things under the seats. Great product. I just wish there were trays available for it. It would make snacking and playing so much easier for them.
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: Great side by side stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller. I love that it's lightweight & compact. The boys love that they can seat side by side & take each others snacks. It was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Kaumoo.hi81

customer_reviews.title: It works...
customer_reviews.text: The stroller it's functional and somewhat lightweight (compared to others I've used). I think it works for what it's intended and the individual reclining feature is great. After a few uses it has gotten wobbly and the clip to keep it folded broke. It still works but the quality could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Padron

customer_reviews.title: This stroller fits the trunk easily. More than that
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time to find a stroller for my infant and 2 year old that would fit in the trunk of my Nissan Altima. This stroller fits the trunk easily. More than that, the quality and maneuverability are great. Both seats and footrests are independently adjustable. It maneuvers well and feels sturdy even with the uneven weight distribution between my 2 month old and 2 year old. I bought the protect a bub sun shield for this also. It works great to augment the sun shades supplied on the stroller. This is one of my favorite mamma purchases and will be useful for years.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lively

customer_reviews.title: Ok stroller
customer_reviews.text: Not so light weight, but overall an ok stroller. My main complaint are the shades, they are cheap (keep coming off every time I touch them) and useless (they don't block anything)!
customer_reviews.author: krysia e lapinski

customer_reviews.title: Best double stroller ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best double stroller ever! I didn`t know which one to buy. I didn`t want to spend a lot of money but also I didn't want to buy something cheap! BEST DECISION! I used it in Miami Beach with my 3 years old girl and 2 years old boy...and it was perfect! lot of space in the bags (when I reclined it, space was a little bit smaller of course). Very "easy to drive", the canopys are great, and it fit perfectly in my car (sonata).
customer_reviews.author: Francisco J.

customer_reviews.title: Mom of twins-This is a must+
customer_reviews.text: It is very durable. My twins love it. The recline is awesome and sits them straight up when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeia

customer_reviews.title: Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I like this stroller for our 2 year old twins but beware because it is quite heavy! Also wish it included a cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is happy
customer_reviews.text: feel strong and durable. I love this. Bought it as a gift and everyone is happy.
customer_reviews.author: JNMA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but way to HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy - but ridiculously heavy. This is not a stroller you want to be traveling with or taking in and out of a car on any sort of regular basis. Easy to assemble though.
customer_reviews.author: MurphySF

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good stroller.
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than expected. Little difficult to get through some doors and isles. Wish the kids had a cup holder. Overall a good stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Rolf

customer_reviews.title: Gets it done
customer_reviews.text: HEAVY! But it rolls great, each side goes down independently, buckles in nice. It survived a trip to IKEA!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Folds up to a surprisingly small footprint. I have taken this on planes and in amusement parks and works so well. Fits in all doors I have tried so far. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jesperson

customer_reviews.title: very good size for a twin stroller and easy to
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty stroller, very good size for a twin stroller and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not light weight
customer_reviews.text: I like the stroller but it’s not light weight at all over all good 😊
customer_reviews.author: Mudassar Javed

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller from a good brand
customer_reviews.text: Folds easy (if I could only remember that one latch - dad brain) easy to fit in any car, buckles are easy to use. Twins seems to like it over our pricey Valco which sits in the garage these days. We tried the cheaper off-brand double but it was very rickety and hard to fold, rode rough too. Returned it for the Chicco.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. MomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This stroller may fold like an umbrella stroller but does not feel like one. I wanted something that folds small but is still strong and sturdy and this fit the bill. However, this thing is HEAVY. Just a warning. Also the seats do not recline completely flat. I don't quite remember what the description said but it's more of a 140 degree angle instead of 180. There is some assembly required but once you do it's very easy and convenient to fold/unfold. And the handle height is tall enough for my 6' husband.
customer_reviews.author: robin liljenquist

customer_reviews.title: I have a Ford Expedition and with my 3rd row seat up it does fit perfect and that's why I originally bought it
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to fit through most doors. I've had this for about a year for my twins and simply have just been using it since it's too late to return it. It's really heavy too. I wished it clipped shut to secure both sides instead of just on one side. I have a Ford Expedition and with my 3rd row seat up it does fit perfect and that's why I originally bought it. It is very well made just frustrating it doesn't fit through doors more easily. It would be nice if the wheel frame curved in so the wheels are under the frame and sticking out a little from the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: JLBednarz

customer_reviews.title: This stroller looks great and the kids love it but it just doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This stroller looks great and the kids love it but it just doesn't turn easy at all. The front end of this could use a makeover!
customer_reviews.author: lynn f

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me when I'm alone w/ my twin grandchildren!
customer_reviews.author: LindaInRB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Double Stroller
customer_reviews.text: We've been through a lot of strollers and this one is one of my favorites. It is well made, easy to maneuver, light enough to easily lift into a minivan or trunk. It folds up small for a double stroller. Both seats recline pretty close to flat and the storage is still accessible and roomy while the seats are reclined. We'll worth the money we paid. We also have a Contours Options and we use the Chicco Echo far more frequently because of the size and weight difference.
customer_reviews.author: F. Schur

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just want I wanted for my 2 month old and 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Spink

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and my kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is perfect for my 3 and 4 year old daughters. We have used this over the past 8 months at the zoo and other places where we walk the majority of the day so it is not an every day stroller for us. The stroller is sturdy, fits through most doors, and my husband loves the turn radius. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to take it through doors and a bit heavy
customer_reviews.author: Giliardi dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy stroller that closes easily. Highly recommend it for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Shepard

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this stroller. Of course it's Chicco and I've loved all my chicco products. I originally bought a tandem double stroller, and although it was attractive it was horrible. Extremely heavy, bulky, and hard to use. The Chicco Echo is extremely easy to use. Folds down small and leaves lots of room in my trunk. Both my 6 mo old and 18 mo old fit perfectly. I recommend this product, yay Chicco!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Just got my Chicco Echo twin stroller and love it. I had a single Chicco and loved ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Chicco Echo twin stroller and love it. I had a single Chicco and loved it too. I have a tandem, but needed an umbrella stroller for our upcoming trip to Florida. This thing is built very well. I bought another brand at first and broke it the first time I tried to put the seats back. Returned it and spent a little more for way better quality. You can never go wrong with a Chicco. r
customer_reviews.author: scott carter

customer_reviews.title: This is the best stroller ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stroller ever. This is my 6th double stroller and I regret not buying it at first place! Fits standard doors, small when closed and easy to fit in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: claudia z

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight double umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight double umbrella stroller. Easy to fold, and not too heavy. Handle on the side makes it easy to lift once folded. My only complaint is the canopies are quite small, but that seems to be how it is with umbrella strollers in general.
customer_reviews.author: monkinjams

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. Easy to use, sturdy, nice canopies for bad weather. Arrived when promised. Works very well for my 1 year old twin grand daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this stroller for our 19 month old twins
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller for our 19 month old twins. Good quality, folds up relatively small, and has nice storage.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The babies both seemed very comfortable for the amount of time that they spent in ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from Disneyland. This stroller worked perfectly! The babies both seemed very comfortable for the amount of time that they spent in it. It's lightweight, easy to steer, and the storage space underneath is great. Only thing I would change would be that the canopies could be a little bigger. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Nattress

customer_reviews.title: Great for two kiddos
customer_reviews.text: My two kids loved sitting side by side for the first time on a walk. It's a tad heavy, but takes up less space folded than the travel system stroller. Time will tell if I love it as much as I think I will, but after one use, it's exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Werner

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can't even look at this stroller anymore. Extremely heavy and very uncomfortable for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: it is very well made and the size was perfect for my boys
customer_reviews.text: TOO HEAVY! We bought this for our 2 yr old twins, to be used as an umbrella stroller for the car. It was so heavy I could barely manage getting it out of the box. 34lbs is too heavy for this type of stroller so we are returning it. Otherwise, it is very well made and the size was perfect for my boys.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie G. Raines

customer_reviews.title: But you can push around very easy and smoothly
customer_reviews.text: This is REALLY HEAVY. But you can push around very easy and smoothly. My kid who is 43 lb can even sit there with a little baby, and still it moves smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: michael pitalo

customer_reviews.title: Godsend
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day. It is wide, but spacious and safe
customer_reviews.author: Shannon ORourke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for outdoor walks, but does not fit through doors
customer_reviews.author: Norma spalding

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the few double strollers I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few double strollers I have found that fits in hybrid trunk. That is what makes it ideal for our family. It is a little tricky to unfold, but folds up well. It does not steer as well as our BOB but it works well for trips to the zoo. My daughter loves that the seats recline and this works well for having having a baby and toddler. The storage under the seats are large enough to hold a big diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: chestercat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't go thru most doors
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't go thrus doors. It was a nightmare and we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: piperarrow2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: My cousin loves this since I gave it to her as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Laurence

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chicco Echo Twin Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love my Chicco Echo Twin Stroller. I was a bit nervous when I first got because the wheels are not like my jogger's wheel, but I was wrong. It has been great. I love this stroller so much. I use it everyday when I got shopping, grocery store, park or run errands! My kids seat comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: Justin mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Functional stroller
customer_reviews.text: I wish the canopy covered more but I do love how easy it is to fold and put away and how light it is. The wheels turn easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rubi

customer_reviews.title: But the return was so easy and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I didn't end up keeping this stroller I decided to go with another brand. But the return was so easy and smooth!
customer_reviews.author: anna beachler

customer_reviews.title: worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great for babies who are non-walkers and could use a change of scenery. Its easy to assemble, wipe down. Also straps and folding are easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: Omg where do I love this stroller for my 1 and 2 year old. This stroller folds up very small easy to store in car and public transportation. The wheels makes it really easy to push no matter how heavy kids are. The seats recline back far and the storage baskets have a nice amount of room the only downside is the canopies dont go that far down and the stroller is a little heavy to carry other than that this is a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Nazirah Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella stroller ever!
customer_reviews.text: Highlights: Folds small enough to fit in our vehicle without taking up all the cargo space handle makes it easy to carry fits through most doorways Nice amount of storage space underneath multiple reclining levels sunshades work well This thing rides and pushes nicer than any other umbrella stroller I have ever used Only negative: its heavy....but that is what happens when you build a quality double umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Overall we love this stroller for our twin 2 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Overall we love this stroller for our twin 2 year olds! We wanted something compact and lighter to travel with. It takes up about half the space when folded as our Chicco tandem stroller. This is a great stroller for traveling when you are tight on space in your vehicle. My only reasons for 4 stars instead of 5 is that I wish it had 2 drink holders and the canopy was larger. It does not block the sun, so pack sun hats and sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Statz

product_meta.title: Chicco Echo Twin Stroller, Coal
product_meta.description:
The echo twin stroller is a practical and compact double stroller that combines comfort for the children and functionality for the parents. The side by side design provides a compact fold, and the carry handle makes it practical and easy for life on the go. Stylish dual canopies adjust individually with zip off rear flaps that help to provide protection from the elements. An embroidered seat pad, European wheel styling, and colored rear tubes combine to make this stroller pop. The rigid, padded backrests can be fully reclined with one hand, both seats independent of each other. Each seat can be adjusted to 4 different positions, and the leg rests can be adjusted to two positions to ensure a comfortable ride.

BRAND STORY
By Chicco

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Kindly contact the manufacturer for any defective issue. Chicco Customer Service – 1-877-424-4226

See more

Mesh storage basket with room for baby's things
Dual front wheels with suspension and locking swivels
Compact fold and carry handle for easy travel and storage
Assembled Dimensions: 33.5 x 30.75 x 41.5 inches,Folded Dimensions: 41 x 14 x 15 inches,Carton Dimensions: 10.5 x 41.75 x 15 inches
